page.title: 16CASTLES IN GLENLIVET
page.content: The{Castle of Blairfindy }was built by John Gordon, Laird of Cluny around 1565. The reason for the existance of this Castle is not known. It has been suggested that it was a hunting-seat of the Earls of Huntly and also that it may have been intended to control the pass through Glenlivet to the south. The castle has long been roofless but the walls are still standing. {Drumin Castle }was built in the fourteenth century. The founder is understood to have been Alexander Stewart, Earl of Buchan, better known as The Wolf of Badenoch. The castle commanded the entrance to the valleys of the Avon and the Livet. In 1490 it passed into the hands of the Gordons with whom it remained until the 1930's when it became part of the Crown Estates. Only some walls remain.
